seasonal: November is generally a positive month for the Euro. In the last 20 years, the Euro closed lower on Nov 11 compared to its price on Nov 4 in approximately 68% of cases. Seasonal bias is generally positive for the Euro in November.

statistics.description: Multi-decade seasonal statistic over the last 20 years: approximately 65% probability of upward movement on Nov 3
Multi-decade seasonal statistic over the last 20 years: approximately 65% probability of downward movement on Nov 11
Multi-decade seasonal statistic over the last 20 years: approximately 71% probability of upward movement on Nov 17
In the last 20 years, EUR/USD closed lower on Nov 11 compared to Nov 4 in 68% of cases - suggesting a decline between these dates

insights: November is generally a positive month for the Euro - seasonal bias is constructive
The statistical significance of the Nov 3 up, Nov 11 down, Nov 17 up pattern suggests a potential trading rhythm for the month
EUR/USD turning dates share several key dates with the S&P 500 (Nov 4, Nov 13-14, Nov 18, Nov 24) suggesting correlated turning points across markets
All dates have a tolerance of +/- one day from the specified turning date
The approach is not to predict direction but to observe price behavior as it arrives at the turning date to determine whether a high, low or consolidation is forming

technical.indicators: No detailed technical chart analysis provided in this report for EUR/USD. The focus is on turning dates and seasonal statistics. Traders should apply their own technical analysis framework on the daily and weekly charts in conjunction with the provided turning dates.

summary: EUR/USD enters November 2025 with a generally positive seasonal bias. The key turning dates are Nov 4, Nov 13-14 (double date), Nov 18, and Nov 24. Seasonal statistics suggest approximately 65% probability of up on Nov 3, 65% probability of down on Nov 11, and 71% probability of up on Nov 17. In the last 20 years, EUR closed lower on Nov 11 vs Nov 4 in 68% of cases, suggesting a potential sell window between those dates.
previous_month_review: October 2025 had four turning dates for EUR/USD. First date (Oct 3) arrived on an upswing and triggered a significant decline to the next turning date. Second date (Oct 10) served as the low of the move and initiated a rally to the next date. Third date (Oct 17) served as the high of the movement - from there a strong decline began, though it briefly reversed higher around Oct 22 (suggesting a missing additional date was needed). Fourth date (Oct 30) arrived one day early (Oct 29) and served as the high - decline began from there toward the first November turning date. All four dates worked effectively in October.
risk_notes: EUR/USD seasonal data is based on 20 years which is a moderate sample size
Several EUR/USD turning dates overlap with S&P 500 dates - cross-asset correlations could amplify or dampen expected moves
No detailed technical support/resistance levels were provided in this month's report - traders should supplement with their own analysis
Currency markets can be heavily influenced by central bank decisions and macroeconomic data releases that may override cycle timing
